title: 114_hr6248
content: The "Spending Safeguard Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes a spending limitation on direct spending programs. The Spending Safeguard Act establishes a spending limitation for direct spending programs, determined by the program's cost within specific budget functions. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget must set this limitation within 90 days of program enactment or reauthorization. The Spending Safeguard Act requires the Director to determine the cost of direct spending programs using scorecards or estimates. The Director must maintain a spending safeguard limitation scorecard and receive monthly reports on spending levels. Additionally, an OMB biannual report is required after six months. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates the Director to assess direct spending program costs using scorecards or estimates. Monthly reports on spending levels are required, along with an OMB biannual report after six months. President budget submissions must include a report on total spending for programs subject to spending safeguard limitations. Procedures in case of breach are outlined. The Spending Safeguard Act requires the Director to assess direct spending program costs using scorecards or estimates. If a program is projected to breach spending limits within six months, a report must be sent to relevant committees. If a program breaches the limit, funds cannot be obligated, and a report must be submitted to the Budget Committees. The Spending Safeguard Act mandates the Director to evaluate direct spending program costs using scorecards or estimates. If a program is forecasted to exceed spending limits within six months, a report must be sent to relevant committees. Federal agencies implementing listed programs must inform participants that the program is subject to a spending safeguard limitation that could affect future fund availability. (g) Prohibition on New Authorization of Funding.--No additional funds are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this Act.
